responses.Question: Eligibility
responses.Answer: A pass in the +2 examination with Mathematics & Physics as compulsory subjects of study with either Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Biology and recognized by any State Board / Central Board or any other accepted by SASTRA as equivalent to 10+2 examination, with a minimum +2 aggregate of 60% marks in a single sitting.

responses.Question: Cut off
responses.Answer: There is no specific cut off formula practised at SASTRA. Please click the following link regarding the procedure followed in admission 👉Click Here

responses.Question: Integrated course
responses.Answer: We have two 5-year integrated course in B.Tech programmes, 4 courses in M.Sc. Programme (5-Years) & 3 courses in B. Ed. Programme Please Visit Below Link to know the B.Tech. admission, procedure, fee structure & eligibility details at 👉Click Here

responses.Question: 5 Year Integrated
responses.Answer: The 5 year Integrated M.Tech. programme (runs concurrently with B.Tech. programme) till the seventh semester, after which the student completes PG level courses in 8th & 9th semesters and project work during the 10th semester. After successful completion, the student will receive the relevant B.Tech. degree and M.Tech. degree.

responses.Question: Integrated
responses.Answer: The 5 year Integrated M.Tech. programme (runs concurrently with B.Tech. programme) till the seventh semester, after which the student completes PG level courses in 8th & 9th semesters and project work during the 10th semester. After successful completion, the student will receive the relevant B.Tech. degree and M.Tech. degree.

responses.Question: M.Tech.

responses.Question: covid-19
responses.Answer: Strictly SOP is followed at the campus. Students who have completed both doses of COVID vaccination are only eligible to attend classes. Wash areas have been installed at various parts of the campus. Santisers are provided to all while entering in to the campus. Premises are frequently sanitised and ensures strict MSD inside the campus

responses.Question: thanjavur campus
responses.Answer: SASTRA is a Category 1 University as per UGC Graded Autonomy Regulations and accredited by the National Assessment & Accreditation Council (NAAC) with “A++” grade . SASTRA has become the first university in India to have the maximum number of undergraduate programmes accredited across its two campuses (Thanjavur and Kumbakonam), demonstrating that the programmes are aligned with internationally recognised standards. Please visit www.sastra.edu

responses.Question: Girls hostel
responses.Answer: There are nine hostels for boys and five for girls. First year B. Tech. students will be provided shared accommodation. The charges for food will be at actual based on dividing system and will approximately be around Rs 3,000 per month. You can assume that you will stay for 10 months in a calendar year. Single room, Two-in-one, Three-in-one and Four-in-one (with or w/o bath attached facilities) will be available from second year onwards. The annual rent will vary depending on the room type.

responses.Answer: There are nine hostels for boys and five for girls. First year B. Tech. students will be provided shared accommodation. responses.Question: Admission 2023
responses.Answer: Admissions to all programmes are strictly based on merit. Admission to the B.Tech./5 year Integrated M.Tech. programme will be conducted under two streams. All the applicants will be eligible for both the stream and need not submit two separate application form. This application form will be considered for the both streams. Please Visit Below Link to understand the complete admission procedure at SASTRA 👉Click Here

responses.Question: Admission 2023-24
responses.Answer: Admissions to all programmes are strictly based on merit. Admission to the B.Tech./5 year Integrated M.Tech. programme will be conducted under two streams. All the applicants will be eligible for both the stream and need not submit two separate application form. This application form will be considered for the both streams. Please Visit Below Link to understand the complete admission procedure at SASTRA 👉Click Here

responses.Question: Application
responses.Answer: Application forms will be available online from the mid week of April 2023 and the last date for submission of completed application forms with JEE Scores and +2 Marks will be decided susequently. The agenda of the admission process will be updated soon

responses.Question: Application form
responses.Answer: Application forms will be available online from the mid week of April 2023 and the last date for submission of completed application forms with JEE Scores and +2 Marks will be decided susequently. The agenda of the admission process will be updated soon

responses.Question: separate application for Stream 1 & Stream 2
responses.Answer: No. Applicants are advised to submit application with results of +2 and JEE (Main) 2023 along with relevant photocopies. JEE (Main) 2023 details is mandatory (if appeared) for those who are applying under Stream 1. The applicant is advised to enter both +2 & JEE (Main) 2023 details in his / her own interest as they can attend both counselling using the same application form.

responses.Question: Stream 1
responses.Answer: Applicants are advised to submit application with results of +2 and JEE (Main) 2023 along with relevant photocopies. JEE (Main) 2023 details is mandatory (if appeared) for those who are applying under Stream 1. The applicant is advised to enter both +2 & JEE (Main) 2023 details in his / her own interest as they can attend both counselling using the same application form.

responses.Question: Counselling date
responses.Answer: Date of Counselling for B.Tech. (Stream 1 & 2) will be decided soon and will be held for atleast 3 weeks. Counselling for admissions to Law programmes shall be held 2 weeks after the release of CLAT 2023 scores. Admissions to all other UG / PG programmes shall be done on a rolling basis as and when application forms are received

responses.Question: counselling

responses.Question: rank list
responses.Answer: Application forms will be available online from the mid week of April 2023 and the last date for submission of completed application forms with JEE Scores and +2 Marks will be decided susequently. The rank list for B.Tech. will be released by 9 pm on the last date of application form and will be available at www.sastra.edu. Based on the results, students will participate in counseling for admissions. The agenda of the admission process will be updated soon

responses.Answer: SASTRA is having 3 courses under LAW programme. Admissions will be based on the CLAT 2023 Scores and +2 aggregate taken in the ratio of 25% : 75% respectively.

responses.Question: Scholarship

Apart from that, we coordinates various scholarship Govermental & Non-Governmental schemes. Feel free to reach out our O/o the Scholarships via 04362-264106; Extn: 2280 . For PG scholarships, supported by AICTE, call to the extn. no: 2308

responses.Question: Application form
responses.Answer: In line with the COVID protocol and to also reduce the carbon footprint and increase transparency in the admission, the entire admission process –application – admission-tuition fee payment – enrolment – withdrawal shall be made online only.Only for non-engineering programmes offered in SRC, Kumbakonam application form can also be collected in person from the Office of Admissions at SASTRA Deemed University campus in Thanjavur and Kumbakonam.Application forms can also be downloaded at www.sastra.edu. Filled applications can also be sent by post along with application fee DD favouring SASTRA payable at Thanjavur. DD must be sent to Office of Admissions, SASTRA Deemed University, Thanjavur – 613 401, Tamil Nadu.

responses.Question: CeNTAB
responses.Answer: The Centre for Nanotechnology & Advanced Biomaterials. The Centre for Nanotechnology & Advanced Biomaterials (CeNTAB) was started in 2005 and dedicated to the nation by His Excellency Dr. A. P. J. Abdul Kalam, then President of India. SASTRA has proactively established this Centre with a view to use Nanotechnology to develop meaningful solutions that would upgrade the quality of life and society. Please visit https://sas.sastra.edu/centab/ to know about further

responses.Question: ASK
responses.Answer: Anusandhan Kendra is a part of SASTRA’s interdisciplinary research initiative integrating Engineering, Life Sciences, Physics & Chemistry. Constructed over an area of 2,00,000 Sq.ft. at a cost of Rs. 42 Crores, this facility houses 76 research labs with state-of- the art facilities like Microscopy Suite(FE-TEM,FE-SEM,AFM,Confocal,etc…), Spectroscopy Suite(XPS, ICPMS,LCMS/MS,etc…) besides other Major equipment and over 20 research labs with a focus on Materials, Sensors, Fluidics etc. at the Nanoscale besides other advanced facilities. In addition, stand-alone research is also actively pursued in the individual academic schools.

responses.Question: DAKSH
responses.Answer: DAKSH, the international techno-management festival of SASTRA University, is an annual event comprising of a myriad of events involving all trades of engineering. It promises to not only be educating but also refreshing for each participant as it attempts to cross boundaries of knowledge beyond textbooks and classrooms.

responses.Question: Kuruksastra
responses.Answer: Kuruksastra, SASTRA's cultural bonanza consists of arts, music, literary events(English, Tamil and Hindi) and dance. Top Institutes from all over India turn up to give fierce competition to each other in the race to win the ultimate prize- the title of overall championship at Kuruksastra.

responses.Question: All India Rank
responses.Answer: 40% will be for students who have completed X and XII in schools outside Tamil Nadu.

responses.Question: Tamil Nadu Rank
responses.Answer: 30% of the intake will be offered to those who complete X and XII in schools within Tamilnadu (Puducherry included).

responses.Question: Trichy Rank
responses.Answer: We admit 20 per cent (10 per cent each from Trichy and Tanjavur) in the BTech courses, and the additional 10 per cent shall be drawn based on merit from among the student applicants who have completed their Class 10th and Class 12th in the Thanjavur & Trichy school districts.

responses.Question: Harassment
responses.Answer: The Management of SASTRA has always endeavoured towards policy compliance & establishing uncompromising standards to ensure that the campus is free from any form of sexual harassment and takes stringent action when such instances comes to its notice.

responses.Question: ragging
responses.Answer: The Management of SASTRA has always endeavoured towards policy compliance & establishing uncompromising standards to ensure that the campus is free from any form of sexual harassment, ragging and takes stringent action when such instances comes to its notice.

responses.Question: INNOVATION
responses.Answer: SASTRA houses two technology business incubators (TBI) with the support from Department of Science & Technology (DST) and Department of Biotechnology (DBT).https://www.sastra.edu/research/innovation.html

responses.Question: safety
responses.Answer: The Sexual Grievances committee as per Vishaka Guidelines now functioning as the Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) has acted on complaints received and the strictest action will be taken against erring staff/girl students leading to expulsion and termination. We always stick in to the guidence and we have appointed a counsellor for girl student safety and who can be contacted round the clock

responses.Question: TBI
responses.Answer: SASTRA houses two technology business incubators (TBI) with the support from Department of Science & Technology (DST) and Department of Biotechnology (DBT).https://www.sastra.edu/research/innovation.html

responses.Question: Ablest
responses.Answer: The Association of Bio-Inspired Leaders and Entrepreneurs at SASTRA-TBI (ABLEST) established in 2020 at a cost of Rs 700 lakh with the support from BIRAC, DBT fosters development of diagnostics and therapeutics. This 5,500 sq.ft. entity has a BSL-3 facility, Next Generation Sequencing, Molecular Biology & Biochemistry facilities, wet lab space, etc., for incubatees to establish proof-of-concept solutions for healthcare. Currently, 12 incubatees are being supported at ABLEST. Both incubators are actively contributing towards combating the pandemic by designing and developing robots for COVID care in isolation wards, drones for disinfection, mobile UV-C sterilizers, oxygen concentrators, 3D printed ventilator splits, face masks & shields, etc.

responses.Question: international
responses.Answer: It has been SASTRA’s constant endeavour to globally engage with renowned institutes of research and learning and to establish standards of excellence in academia and research. The Semester Abroad Programme was started in the year 2009 at SASTRA University as the University’s attempt to establish a regular exchange of students with specific foreign universities. Applications for the Semester Abroad Programme ( SAP) are invited in the month of August every year, followed by interviews and the decision communicated to the students in the month of September every year in order to facilitate their paper work for travelling abroad.

responses.Question: SAP
responses.Answer: It has been SASTRA’s constant endeavour to globally engage with renowned institutes of research and learning and to establish standards of excellence in academia and research. Applications for the Semester Abroad Programme ( SAP) are invited in the month of August every year, followed by interviews and the decision communicated to the students in the month of September every year in order to facilitate their paper work for travelling abroad.

responses.Question: Hospital
responses.Answer: Vaidyanatha Arogyasala' the in-house hospital with 10 beds and regular doctors caters to the medical need of the students. Two fulltime doctors, one resident doctor besides adequate paramedical staff are available at the hospital. The hospital is adequately equipped with sophisticated equipment and is prepared to meet any medical emergency round the clock. The medical consultation is offered free and is also extended to the nearby villages surrounding SASTRA.
